Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos; interior glazed black with band in faded added colour around top of rim; exterior: upper part glazed with possible traces of added red; below, two bands in dilute brown above black-figure decoration consisting of standing male figure (upper body remaining, wearing himation) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 19)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 363, no. B479)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1264) (phase 3)
